value.title: Pardon the Intrusion #26: Facial recognition? That’s a no from me, dog
value.excerpt: Portland, Oregon has become the first US city to ban the use of facial recognition tech by both public and private businesses.

value.title: Portland Just Passed Our Country's Broadest Ban On Facial Recognition
value.excerpt: Portland, Oregon might be best known as the home of bohemian stereotypes a- plenty and some of the wildest donuts you can find in the state. Now it’s also earned the reputation for ambitious privacy legislation after passing the country’s broadest ban on facial recognition technology to date.

value.title: Portland's facial recognition ban is a major win, especially against Amazon
value.excerpt: "The dangers and inequities in the current technology are present and clear," explained Portland Mayor Ted Wheeler.

value.title: Norfolk, Va., PD Used Facial Recognition, Not Even Officials Knew
value.excerpt: The Clearview AI application was piloted by police in the city, but most city leaders and the public had no idea it was being used. The technology has raised concerns among civil rights and privacy advocates.

value.title: NIST benchmarks show facial recognition technology still struggles to identify Black faces
value.excerpt: NIST benchmarks suggest some facial recognition algorithms haven't corrected historic bias -- and are actually getting worse.
